p: To a solution of benzylated derivative 9 or 10 (0.20 mmol) in a 1:1 CH 2Cl 2‒MeOH mixture (6 ml), AcOH (0.4 ml) and Pd(OH) 2/C (150 mg) were added, and the corresponding mixture was hydrogenated for 24 h. After that, it was filtered over a Celite ® pad and washed with MeOH. The filtrate was concentrated to dryness and purified by column chromatography (190:10:1 → 140:60:1 CH 2Cl 2‒MeOH‒Et 3N) in the case of 11. For compounds 12, no further purification was accomplished after filtration. Derivatives 11 and 12 were obtained as colourless syrups (See Supplementary Material).
